column4: please I need help, I can't boot after login in graphic mode, not with ati nor with nvidia, im getting the same error. Help please!
let us know the error
simply nothing, the screen gets freezed just after logging and just before showing up the screen "loading nautilus, etc" and I can't see the desktop
does it go to a terminal session if you type ctrl+alt+f1
ok, try killing gdm now with sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop, and then hit 'startx'
as user
no error, just the desktop is a grey squared screen
what card do you  have?
and what version of ubuntu?
ok, with the nvidia card -- try installing the nvidia drivers (/msg ubotu nvidia) and try startx again
it has appeared a grey square in the top left corner of the screen, but I still can't do nothing
I already tried
startx gives you the exact same thing, are you sure?
also, what about the other details?
what details?
and what version of ubuntu?
any idea?
ok, did you upgrade?
ok, curious. Could you startx with the nvidia drivers, then ctrl+alt+backspace when things muck up, and pastebin me the output
coultd not init font path element /usr/share/fonts/X11/TTf
I'm sure there's more than that. Could you pastebin it all?
ok, but make sure you note any part that says Error or E. Paste in #flood
really sorry but I have to shoot to a lecture now, I'm already quite late :P. If no-one else can help in the meantime, I'll try to help when I'm back
look at #flood
